WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You're sitting on your stool again!!?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: There's someone you know who carries a stool around with her all the time. Why? Because she's super pregnant and can't walk too far. You're walking with her, but she has to stop every few feet and sit on her stool, again and again. Feel irritated about this, because it will help you to remember the meaning of this kanji better. Imagine this scene taking place several times as you're trying to walk to your destination together, but she's too slow and it's super-duper irritating.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: So, she's really pregnant, and carrying a stool, sitting on it again and again. Where are you two going? Where would a super preggers person go? Well, she needs to go to the matanity (ã¾ãŸ) store to get new clothes for her giant baby stomach.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: I know "mata" and "maternity" are a bit of a stretch, but the goal is to get you to the memory of ã¾ãŸ in your head, so they don't necessarily need to be exactly the same. If this can get you to the correct memory in your head, then it does the right thing, and that's good. So, make that your goal and you'll probably remember the reading for this kanji!

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This looks like a crotch which is a part of the mans body which receives attention again and again.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Offerings sacrificed for royal ancestral rites. There are multiple layers of meat on the altar. The meat sacrificed for the rites is considered very sacred. After the ceremony, the sacrificial meat is delivered to the nobles in whom the King trusts. (æœ‰, you, have) On top of the symbol is the right hand (åˆ, you, again) delivering sacrificial offerings to the others repeatedly, and the below (è‚‰, rou, flesh) is the sacrificed meat. Because the meat belongs to the King or owners, (æœ‰, you, have) this character was used as â€˜to haveâ€™. The carcases of large animals like cows or sheep were cut up to fit inside the cauldron. After the ritual, the cauldron would be emptied using a round ladle. (å“¡, å‘˜, yuan=yÃ¼an, member) shows using a round ladle to scoop up something from the bronze cauldron. After the ceremony the King shared the contents cooked in the bronze cauldron with his court. Therefore, the character å“¡ (å‘˜, yuan, member) came to mean people belonging to the organization, or civil servants.,The symbol for â€œFatherâ€ (çˆ¶, fu, father) shows a person holding something long in his hand (åˆ, you, again). According to â€œShuo Wen Jie Zi,â€ this shows the authority figureâ€™s hand holding a whip for teaching and punishment. However, the authority figure is not just holding a plain whip. He is holding a Jade Panel, which symbolizes power and authority of kings and aristocrats. So the thing he is holding is not merely a whip but a symbol of power.
humanum_full_description_en:
A gold inscription is like the side of a right hand. The original meaning is the right hand. "Said Wen": "Yo, hand. Pictogram. Three fingers, there are many rows of hands, but slightly less than three. Anything that belongs to you is from you." Duan Yucai's note: "This is the right word of the present." after being under the guise of " again ", " more " meaningful " and ", and to " the right " special representation right hand, right hand around.

Jia Jinwen means left and right. It is also commonly used as " you ", such as the inscription "you (have) heavy rain", the inscription "you ğ¤”²", later generations "yousi", generally refers to officials. Oracle is also used as a sacrifice name. Bronze is also the first text of " right " and " you ", which means auxiliary, the death of heaven: "The death of heaven (you) king".
humanum_short_description_en: A golden inscription is like a right hand, the original meaning is the right hand.

origin_of_ch_char_book: Offerings sacrificed for royal ancestral rites. There are multiple layers of meat on the altar. The meat sacrificed for the rites is considered very sacred. After the ceremony, the sacrificial meat is delivered to the nobles in whom the King trusts. (æœ‰, you, have) On top of the symbol is the right hand (åˆ, you, again) delivering sacrificial offerings to the others repeatedly, and the below (è‚‰, rou, flesh) is the sacrificed meat. Because the meat belongs to the King or owners, (æœ‰, you, have) this character was used as â€˜to haveâ€™. The carcases of large animals like cows or sheep were cut up to fit inside the cauldron. After the ritual, the cauldron would be emptied using a round ladle. (å“¡, å‘˜, yuan=yÃ¼an, member) shows using a round ladle to scoop up something from the bronze cauldron. After the ceremony the King shared the contents cooked in the bronze cauldron with his court. Therefore, the character å“¡ (å‘˜, yuan, member) came to mean people belonging to the organization, or civil servants.,The symbol for â€œFatherâ€ (çˆ¶, fu, father) shows a person holding something long in his hand (åˆ, you, again). According to â€œShuo Wen Jie Zi,â€ this shows the authority figureâ€™s hand holding a whip for teaching and punishment. However, the authority figure is not just holding a plain whip. He is holding a Jade Panel, which symbolizes power and authority of kings and aristocrats. So the thing he is holding is not merely a whip but a symbol of power.

A gold inscription is like the side of a right hand. The original meaning is the right hand. "Said Wen": "Yo, hand. Pictogram. Three fingers, there are many rows of hands, but slightly less than three. Anything that belongs to you is from you." Duan Yucai's note: "This is the right word of the present." after being under the guise of " again", " more" meaningful " and", and to " the right" special representation right hand, right hand around. Jia Jinwen means left and right. It is also commonly used as " you", such as the inscription "you (have) heavy rain", the inscription "you ğ¤”²", later generations "yousi", generally refers to officials. Oracle is also used as a sacrifice name. Bronze is also the first text of " right" and " you", which means auxiliary, the death of heaven: "The death of heaven (you) king".

yÃ²u
It means to repeat or continue, and it means the same: it rains again today.
It means to emphasize the tone and take it one step further: You are not a child!
It means that several situations or several properties exist at the same time: high and big.
Plus, there is: and again. Ten and five years.
Indicates a turning point: This person is quite familiar, and can't remember what his name is.

(4) Adverbs. Indicates that the meaning goes a step further.
(5) Adverbs. Indicates that there is a supplement outside a certain range.
(6) Adverbs. Indicates that zeros are added to the integer.
(7) Adverbs. Two things that are contradictory.
(8) Adverbs. Indicates a turning point.
(9) Adverbs. Used in negative or rhetorical questions to strengthen the tone.
(10) Through "you". forgive.
(11) Through "Yes".
(12) Through "You". bless.

Meaning Mnemonic
You're sitting on your stool again!!?
There's someone you know who carries a stool around with her all the time. Why? Because she's super pregnant and can't walk too far. You're walking with her, but she has to stop every few feet and sit on her stool, again and again. Feel irritated about this, because it will help you to remember the meaning of this kanji better. Imagine this scene taking place several times as you're trying to walk to your destination together, but she's too slow and it's super-duper irritating.

I know "mata" and "maternity" are a bit of a stretch, but the goal is to get you to the memory of ã¾ãŸ in your head, so they don't necessarily need to be exactly the same. If this can get you to the correct memory in your head, then it does the right thing, and that's good. So, make that your goal and you'll probably remember the reading for this kanji!
